intro: Leandra pallida var. hispidula, commonly known as the pale leandra or hispid leandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Central and South America, where it typically grows in tropical or subtropical regions. The plant features soft, fuzzy leaves and produces small, pale pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
